trans-unit.source: Each Windows Store transaction that results in a successful product purchase can optionally return a transaction receipt.
trans-unit.target: Each Windows Store transaction that results in a successful product purchase can optionally return a transaction receipt.

trans-unit.source: This receipts provides information about the listed product and monetary cost to the customer.
trans-unit.target: This receipts provides information about the listed product and monetary cost to the customer.

trans-unit.source: Having access to this information supports scenarios where your app needs to verify that a user purchased your app, or has made in-app product purchases from the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: Having access to this information supports scenarios where your app needs to verify that a user purchased your app, or has made in-app product purchases from the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: For example, imagine a game that offers downloaded content.
trans-unit.target: For example, imagine a game that offers downloaded content.

trans-unit.source: If the user who purchased the game content wants to play it on a different device, you need to verify that the user already owns the content.
trans-unit.target: If the user who purchased the game content wants to play it on a different device, you need to verify that the user already owns the content.

trans-unit.source: Requesting a receipt
trans-unit.target: Requesting a receipt

trans-unit.source: The **Windows.ApplicationModel.Store** namespace supports two ways of getting a receipt: by using the [**CurrentApp.RequestProductPurchaseAsync | requestProductPurchaseAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263381) or [**CurrentApp.RequestAppPurchaseAsync | requestAppPurchaseAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh967813) method and using the *includeReceipt* parameter, or by calling the [**CurrentApp.GetAppReceiptAsync | getAppReceiptAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh967811) method.
trans-unit.target: The **Windows.ApplicationModel.Store** namespace supports two ways of getting a receipt: by using the [**CurrentApp.RequestProductPurchaseAsync | requestProductPurchaseAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263381) or [**CurrentApp.RequestAppPurchaseAsync | requestAppPurchaseAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh967813) method and using the *includeReceipt* parameter, or by calling the [**CurrentApp.GetAppReceiptAsync | getAppReceiptAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh967811) method.
